DspNetwork.brief: The top-level container that manages a ScriptNode DSP graph, providing methods to create, retrieve, and process nodes.

seeAlso.distinction: DspNetwork manages the ScriptNode DSP graph (create/connect nodes); Builder programmatically creates the HISE module tree (synths, effects, modulators) -- different systems entirely.
DspNetwork is the modern ScriptNode graph container; DspModule is the legacy API for loading external DSP libraries.

DspModule.brief: Legacy API for loading and controlling an external DSP module instance from a DspFactory, predating the ScriptNode system.

seeAlso.distinction: DspModule is the legacy API for external DSP libraries with manual processBlock calls; Node is the modern ScriptNode graph API where processing is managed by the network.
DspModule processes audio via an external library; DspNetwork hosts the entire ScriptNode graph that contains Node objects.

Node.brief: A processing unit within a ScriptNode DSP network that can be connected, bypassed, and configured with parameters.

seeAlso.distinction: Node is a unit in the modern ScriptNode graph with automatic signal routing; DspModule is the legacy API requiring manual processBlock calls on external libraries.
Node is a single processing element; DspNetwork is the container that holds and manages all nodes.

Parameter.brief: A named parameter of a ScriptNode Node that holds a value with range properties and can receive modulation connections.

seeAlso.distinction: Parameter controls a single value on a Node; Node is the processing unit that owns one or more Parameters.
Parameter is the target endpoint that holds a value; Connection is the link object that routes modulation from a source node to a Parameter.

Connection.brief: A modulation or signal connection between a source node and a target parameter within a ScriptNode graph.

seeAlso.distinction: Connection is the link object that routes a signal to a Parameter; Parameter is the endpoint that receives the value.
Connection represents the wiring between nodes; Node is the processing unit that produces or consumes the signal.

ContainerChild.brief: A reference to a child component inside a ScriptDynamicContainer, providing property access, hierarchy traversal, and value/paint callbacks.

seeAlso.distinction: ContainerChild is a reference to a single child within a dynamic container; ScriptDynamicContainer is the parent component that owns and manages all children.
ContainerChild is a lightweight child reference within a dynamic container; ScriptPanel is a standalone UI component with full paint and mouse callback support.

NetworkTest.brief: A test harness for verifying ScriptNode DSP network output by running processing with configurable specs, runtime functions, and buffer comparison.

seeAlso.distinction: NetworkTest is a test harness created from a DspNetwork to verify its audio output; DspNetwork is the live DSP graph that produces audio.
